title: Bayesian Data Analysis with Python
text:
Preface
This book is about doing data analysis in Python using a Bayesian approach. The contents are mainly based on the Coursera specialization about Bayesian Statistics (Heiner et al. n.d.), but will gradually be supplemented with practical examples and additional theory from other resources such as Doing Bayesian Data Analysis (Kruschke 2015).




Heiner, Matthew, Herbert Lee, Abel Rodriguez, Raquel Prado, and Jizhou Kang. n.d. “Bayesian Statistics.” Coursera.


Kruschke, John K. 2015. Doing Bayesian Data Analysis: A Tutorial with r, JAGS, and Stan. 2nd ed. Academic Press.

title: 1  Introduction
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See Kruschke (2015) for additional discussion of literate programming.


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import scipy.stats

xs = np.linspace(-5, 5, num=500, endpoint=False)
ys = scipy.stats.norm.pdf(x=xs, loc=0.0, scale=1)
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(2.8, 2.8))
ax.plot(xs, ys, lw=2, c="gray")
ax.set_xlabel(f"$x$")
ax.set_ylabel(f"$p(x)$")
ax.set_aspect("auto")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()








Figure 1.1: A standard normal distribution.









Kruschke, John K. 2015. Doing Bayesian Data Analysis: A Tutorial with r, JAGS, and Stan. 2nd ed. Academic Press.
